content:
Claire makes a 3 egg omelet every morning for breakfast.  How many dozens of eggs will she eat in 4 weeks?
Now please strictly answer this question in the json format: "{"reasons": "(a string of your reasoning process)", "answer": "(a pure numeric value without unit)"}"

{"reasons": "Claire makes a 3 egg omelet every morning, so in 4 weeks (28 days) she will eat 3 eggs x 28 days = 84 eggs. To convert this to dozens, we divide 84 eggs by 12 eggs per dozen, which gives us 7 dozens.", "answer": "7"}

There are 2 groups of people discussing on the same math word question. I will provide you the detailed reasons and answers from your group member and answers from other group members. Use these opinions and your previous answer as additional advice, note that they maybe wrong. Do not copy other's entire answer, modify the part you believe is wrong.

Other group members' opinions:
Three agents think the answer is 7.

Your group's opinions:
Two agents think the answer is 7. Below are their responses:
{"reasons": "Claire makes a 3 egg omelet every morning, so in a week she will eat 3 eggs * 7 days = 21 eggs. Since there are 4 weeks in a month, she will eat 21 eggs * 4 weeks = 84 eggs. To convert this to dozens, we divide 84 eggs / 12 eggs per dozen = 7 dozens.", "answer": "7"}

{"reasons": "Claire makes a 3 egg omelet every morning. There are 7 days in a week, so she eats 3 * 7 = 21 eggs in a week. There are 4 weeks in a month, so she eats 21 * 4 = 84 eggs in 4 weeks. There are 12 eggs in a dozen, so she eats 84 / 12 = 7 dozens of eggs in 4 weeks.", "answer": "7"}

{"reasons": "Claire makes a 3 egg omelet every morning, so in 4 weeks (28 days) she will eat 3 eggs x 28 days = 84 eggs. To convert this to dozens, we divide 84 eggs by 12 eggs per dozen, which gives us 7 dozens.", "answer": "7"}
